mobs.keywords: dargentan dar huge large dragon sleeping peaceful
mobs.long_desc: A huge silver dragon is sleeping peacefully here.
mobs.desc: This dragon is truly massive.  The bright, burnished-silver color of his scales shines brightly in even the dimmest of light.  He seems not at all bothered by the cold here in the clouds, though his claws have tiny ice crystals embedded in them from the constant wind and cold weather.  His position is that of guarding the realms below, always on the lookout for hostile invaders from the skies.  A dragon sleeps with one eye open, after all.

mobs.keywords: fallen paladin despondent man sad Uziel
mobs.long_desc: A despondent-looking man gazes sadly at the scenery.
mobs.desc: Wrapped up in a warm cloak against the cold, this man's eyes are haunted and he looks haggard.  His right arm seems to be made of a metallic substance, looking to be of dwarven manufacture.  He constantly clutches at his chest as though there is a pendant hidden under his clothing, but he never looks at it. Instead his gaze is directed at the impressive view from the floating fortress, trying to decide whether or not to jump.

mobs.keywords: mage wandering-mage frustrated-elven-mage elf wizard Oranyn Bluehawk
mobs.long_desc: A frustrated elven mage stares at the symbols on the wall.
mobs.desc: He would be quite handsome if he didn't have an expression of frustrated anger on his face, as this elf has flawless features and long, beautiful blond hair.  Dressed in robes of blue and white, he has a distracted air about him. Strange smells emanating from his robes suggest spell components.

mobs.keywords: tempest manifest storm incarnation trapped tempest-manifest
mobs.long_desc: A storm incarnate rages here, trapped.
mobs.desc: Angry swirls of ugly grey color the room, lit occasionally by static shocks as the elemental-like creature rages for a way out.  Not even vaguely humanoid, the storm-in-miniature nonetheless manages to communicate its anger rather strongly.  However, no matter what it tries it cannot leave the room.

mobs.long_desc: A lightning beast paces back and forth restlessly.
mobs.desc: Vaguely resembling a large canine, this creature's features are little more than suggestions of form, as the constant crackling of the elemental force of lightning is continually in motion.  Though its borders are more fluid than most creatures, it has a definite center around where its heart would be if it were a mammal.  A snarling can be heard over its innate hum-crackle, and it seems quite restless.

mobs.long_desc: Ice coalesces into a snarling form here.
mobs.desc: A small, bipedal, tailed creature formed of ice zips back and forth in the air without seemingly noticing anything else.  Its features are locked in an expression of anger, as the tiny elemental-like creature seems to be looking for something without success.  Unlike an elemental, however, the mephit is at once more sharply edged, with pointy little ears and horns, and more aggressive than a pure manifestation of ice should be.

mobs.long_desc: A bit of cloud floats away from the path here.
mobs.desc: Upon closer inspection, this cloud resembles a tiny, fluffy humanoid.  Wispy bits of cloud define its limbs, including a tail and either hair or horns on its head.  It moves slowly around the path as if searching for something, though it has no visible eyes or ears.  It seems quite solid.

mobs.long_desc: A giant hawk ruffles its feathers against the cold here.
mobs.desc: Nearly as large as a halfling, this hawk is dappled with light brown spots and has a creamy white breast.  Its feathers are ruffled up to preserve heat, making it appear even larger than it actually is.  Razor-sharp talons look capable of ripping its prey to shreds without much effort, and its beak is sharp as well.

mobs.long_desc: An air sprite is floating here, laughing in delight.
mobs.desc: A blue-skinned being with wispy features zips around, heedless of its surroundings.  It seems uninterested in anything but tracing the currents of air and often turns itself sideways or even upside-down trying to get a better look at whirls and gusts that only it can see.  It laughs at random, delighted by the play of the invisible currents.

mobs.keywords: gently glowing sphere light lantern archon celestial
mobs.long_desc: A gently glowing sphere of light hovers here.
mobs.desc: A warm, perfectly spherical ball of light floats here, radiating comfort and peace.  It moves slowly and seems somehow dignified.  Though it has no visible features, its movements do not seem as random as one would expect from a creature of no intelligence.

mobs.long_desc: A green-skinned avenger stalks back and forth restlessly.
mobs.desc: Though his height and green skin bring to mind a swamp troll, nothing else about this gracious being is in the least bit trollish.  His skin is green but also slightly luminescent, and his features are finely sculpted like those of an elf.  Four wings spread out from his back, dappled with golden and silver feathers.  His body is well-muscled and he looks dangerous to cross.

mobs.keywords: celestial seraph lesser lesser-seraph being holy white six
mobs.long_desc: A holy being with six white wings stands here.
mobs.desc: Only vaguely humanoid in appearance, looking too long at the seraph would probably hurt the eyes.  Its six wings rest behind it, feathers gently ruffling in the breeze.  Its eyes are like tiny stars, and though it seems peaceful it also looks quite dangerous.  A feeling of calm radiates from it, but it would surely not hesitate to defend itself if attacked.

mobs.keywords: softly glowing being solar celestial solar-celestial
mobs.long_desc: A softly glowing being reclines against the walls, smiling.
mobs.desc: She would look human if not for the pale golden aura streaked with the colors of sunset extending from her body.  On her forehead is the symbol of the setting sun, glowing brightly.  She seems to be amused, though at what she is amused is not clear.  Her white garments look like priestly robes, judging by the holy signs on them.

mobs.keywords: golden wind young woman form sylph lair-sylph
mobs.long_desc: Golden wind forms the shape of a young woman here.
mobs.desc: The winds gather and become a golden-yellow color here, forming the shape of an attractive young woman.  Barely visible except for the color, she appears to move by walking an inch or so off the ground.  A playful expression on her face and the inherent grace with which she walks combined with her slender form would make her quite beautiful, as long as you didn't mind the fact that she is made entirely out of air.

mobs.long_desc: Currents of air swirl strangely around the ground.
mobs.desc: All that is visible are the swirls of air at the ground that indicate movement, even to eyes that can see the invisible.  Perhaps it is made completely of air, or perhaps it exists on another plane.

mobs.long_desc: Barely visible, a figure stalks around.
mobs.desc: Ripples in your field of vision resolve themselves into the figure of a barely humanoid creature.  Oddly, it is easier to see when it moves than when it is standing still.  Its presence is a bit chilling, but that could just be the inherent cold of its building.  A glimmer around his waist level might be a weapon, or it might be a trick of the light.  Such a creature would make an extremely deadly assassin.

mobs.long_desc: A blue-skinned djinn floats on a cloud here.
mobs.desc: Legs and arms crossed, this bearded humanoid floats on his own little cloud rather than walking around.  His age is difficult to tell, for though his skin is free of wrinkles, his eyes seem ageless rather than old or young.  Tiny sparkles trail his cloud when it moves, adding to the djinn's exotic appearance.  His glare suggests he does not wish to be bothered.

mobs.long_desc: A graceful, snakelike creature floats here serenely.
mobs.desc: Covered in brilliant green and blue feathers, this winged snake has sharp fangs and gleaming golden eyes.  It flies around, making sinuous patterns with its long, thin tail.  Seemingly well adapted to life at the highest altitudes, its thick skin is pale and barely visible beneath the colorful plumage.  Noble in appearance, the couatl is a rare and beautiful beast and indicates luck in some cultures.

mobs.long_desc: A majestic bird of ice floats serenely here.
mobs.desc: Much, much larger than an ordinary bird, the garuda brings to mind the phoenix, only where a phoenix is a creature of fire, this is a creature of ice. Plumage in the colors of deep blue through a translucent white cover the bird, giving it a shimmering, flowing appearance.  Tiny snowflakes trail in its wake, leaving a trail behind it.  Its beak and talons look razor-sharp and cold, promising painful damage to anyone foolish enough to bother the noble creature.

mobs.long_desc: A woman dressed in holy robes is wandering here.
mobs.desc: This woman is dressed in robes covered in holy symbols and has a luminescence in her eyes suggesting enlightenment.  Her hair is a golden-silver tangle, looking almost like a halo over her head.  She smiles gently, as though she knows something the rest of the world doesn't.  Graceful movements and a soft feeling of kindness mark her as one favored by the gods.

mobs.keywords: pale skinned pale-skinned figure air genasi
mobs.long_desc: A pale-skinned figure is here, studying the walls.
mobs.desc: Not quite human in appearance, this tall being has a definite kinship with the creatures of the wind.  Her features are sharp and her eyes bright blue.  Her skin, for that matter, is also blue: a pale shade, like the winter sky.  Her movements are graceful, and her white hair is constantly in motion.

mobs.long_desc: A noble hound rests here, its eyes constantly moving.
mobs.desc: Pure white in color, this hound looks both wise and mighty.  Its movements are fluid and its build sinuous.  Golden eyes give its face an otherwordly look, and it is constantly glancing around and sniffing the air for the scent of something.  It moves without a sound, gracefully.

objects.ground: A platinum ring set with a rare blue diamond lies here.

extras.text: This ring is very beautiful.  The diamond is a rare blue color, accented by the platinum it is set in.  Faint outlines of a swirling cloud motif add texture to the ring, though barely enough to notice.  It looks like it was made for a lady's hand...  A very wealthy lady's hand.

objects.ground: A golden ring inset with a sapphire lies here.

extras.text: A slender golden band with delicate whorls of knotwork is the setting for a rather remarkable gem.  Though it is a small sapphire, no bigger than a wheat kernel, it is shaped into the form of a hawk descending onto ints prey, talons outsretched.  It was surely crafted by magic, for what gemcrafter, no matter how skilled, could perfectly replicate something that small and detailed?

objects.ground: A lone snowflake glimmers on the floor.

extras.text: It seems to be a snowflake set onto a tiny silver post.  The six-pointed flake is cool to the touch, though it does not melt.  Whatever crystal substance it is made of catches the light quite well, giving it an ever-present sparkle. Its miniscule arms have hexagonal symmetry, and it is very detailed.

objects.ground: A hawk's talons lie discarded here.

extras.text: Extremely sharp, this pair of claws is less brittle than the talons of a lesser beast would be.  Designed by nature to be the bane of small animals, the talons could probably be used as a weapon, though their usefulness would be questionable.

objects.ground: A pair of disembodied bird eyes is sitting here.

extras.text: When placed over the eyes, this extra set of eyes seems to focus one's vision more, lending detail to even the most plain-seeming objects.  They float in place magically, synchronizing perfectly with the eyes they are worn over. Seems a little odd, but they do help.

objects.ground: A greyish stone ring shines brightly here.

extras.text: Though it looks like metal, this ring is actually made out of the lustrous stone hematite.  It is slightly more brittle than a metal ring and very cool to the touch.  It looks like it would fit a slender finger better than a thick one - it would be a shame to have such a nice ring shatter.

objects.ground: A sharp icicle lies here.

extras.text: A sharp icicle seems to be magically preserved, for it does not melt even when taken to warm climates.  Thin string wrapped around the thick base acts as a grip, indicating that it could be used as a weapon.  Whether or not it would be a very effective weapon, however, is yet to be seen.

objects.ground: A bracelet of lightning crackles with energy here.

extras.text: A tingling feeling radiates from this bracelet, which appears to be made out of the elemental force of lightning.  It is colored a pale bluish-white, and beneath the sparking there seems to be some kind of hard base, so wearing it on the wrist would be quite possible.

objects.ground: A pile of clear fabric is barely visible here.

extras.text: Only its nearly translucent shadow gives an indication that this mantle is not just a figment of the imagination.  Lightweight but not quite weightless, it has clear strings at one end that indicate it could be tied around the shoulders and worn as a mantle.  One end is even slightly weighted, making it fall gracefully into artistic folds, barely visible.

objects.ground: A pair of white gloves radiate power here.

extras.text: Made of a smooth white cloth, these gloves are very stiff.  They have a slight glow and radiate a feeling of strength, though they are cold to the touch.  A faint tingle also permeates the fabric, indicating that they were definitely created with magic.

objects.ground: A cloak with the emblem of a dragon on it lies in a pile here.

extras.text: Made of a rough, heavy silk, the cloak is a tan color lined in white and, judging by the way the fabric drapes, would sweep out impressively behind anyone wearing it.  The dragon symbol is set in the center of the back, showing a pale dragon done in metallic thread shimmering in the light, standing rampant with a five-taloned foot raised as if in greeting.  The dragon looks, as dragons tend to, extremely fierce.  Inside the collar in gray thread is the maker's mark stitched into the fabric, but it is faint enough that it cannot be read.

objects.short: a memento of a lover's soul
objects.ground: A platinum locket glimmers here.

extras.text: A small locket, barely larger than a fingernail, is nonetheless very valuable as it is made out of the rare and precious metal platinum.  Flipping the tiny catch reveals a lock of hair tied with a thick thread.  The hair looks to be made of precious metals itself, but it is very soft to the touch and radiates a comforting feeling, gold and silver catching the light and shining brightly. A feeling of sadness and loss infuses the locket, and if it had any identifying marks they were rubbed away by the constant feeling of hands against the metal. It is undoubtedly valuable in more ways than one.  An inscription runs around the edge of the amulet.
It reads, "My thought will be for you My love will be in you You are the one to love me So I will live forever"

objects.ground: A key formed out of white cloud is floating serenely here.

extras.text: It's a key made of the same solid cloudlike substance that makes up the cloudy path.

objects.ground: A sparkling key sits here.

extras.text: A hard, cool substance that sparkles in the light is fashoned into the shape of a key.

objects.ground: A key made of shining light is resting here.

extras.text: Cool to the touch, this key emits brilliant light in a yellow-red color.  Its head is in the shape of the sun, and it feels comforting when held.

objects.ground: A hexagonal crystal glimmers in the light here.

extras.text: A solid crystal attached to a silver chain looks like it is made of ice, and indeed it is cool to the touch.  It does not melt when worn, an indicator that it was probably made with magic.  The crystal itself has six-sided symmetry and is a translucent pale blue-white, distorting objects slightly if looked through.  The chain is rather long and would probably fit adventurers large and small.

objects.ground: A glowing key pulses with energy here.

extras.text: A key made of silver with an unusual blue glow, it is fairly large.  Etched on one side of the key is a triskelene pattern.

objects.ground: An abandoned bowl inlaid with silver rests here.

extras.text: A bowl made of a blackened metal inlaid with silver sits here.  Inside it are smudge marks that smell faint but sweet, probably from incense.  The silver forms intricate knotwork shapes, some tarnished but others bright.  At the bottom is the symbol of a raven with wings outstretched outlined in silver with feathers and talons marked with thinner lines than the rest of the inlay.

objects.ground: A sphere glows softly on the ground.

extras.text: A hard, round shell which feels almost chitinous emits a soft golden light and a warm feeling, though there is no actual heat coming from it.  It is about the size of an ogre's clenched fist and is heavy but feels hollow rather than solid.

objects.ground: A pile of iridescent cloth lies here.

extras.text: An airy-light robe of the finest silk shimmers and shines in the light, reflecting many colors that change as it is moved.  Every color in the rainbow is represented here and there, though if the fabric is moved the colors shift again.  It looks like it is all made of one solid piece of fabric, hemmed only at the collar and the sleeves.  It looks like it would be loose but comfortable to wear.

objects.ground: Iridescent silk leggings lie here.

extras.text: Feather-light silk is artfully sewn into leggings, gathered at the waist and tied with a light string of the same fabric.  The silk is many-colored, changing as it is moved and shimmering in the light.  They look like they would be rather baggy, but comfortable - how not, as they are made of the finest silk?

objects.ground: A gleaming tiara lies here.

extras.text: Very cold to the touch, this circlet is made of silver worked into angular designs and inset with a large, teardrop-shaped sapphire at the crown.  The silver gleams brightly, showing no sign of tarnish, and the sapphire is a true deep blue with an inner radiance all its own.

objects.ground: A blue flame floats in midair.

extras.text: A small blue flame is here, neither cold nor warm to the touch.  It seems to float a few feet off the floor, regardless of being nudged or pushed in any other direction.  It shines very brightly, almost to the point where it hurts the eyes if looked at directly.  It is a pale blue in the center, almost white, but it darkens to the color of sapphire around the edges.

objects.ground: A heap of silver scales lies here.

extras.text: A quicksilver mess of barely-defined scales and membranes resolves itself into a pair of wings upon closer inspection.  They seem to magically resize themselves if worn, becoming closer to the size of the wearer as though to fit them personally.  Once worn, they attach themselves seamlessly to the wearer's back and look like an extra set of limbs that could probably be used for their original purpose: flight.  Their value seems beyond reckoning.

objects.ground: A silver maul inlaid with gold lies here.

extras.text: An ancient form of weapon similar to a maul, the goremaul is set with tiny barbs at the head to cause ripping damage along with the usual bludgeon.  Its handle is silver with a worn, white leather grip and the head of the goremaul is inlaid with orichalcum, a rare alloy of gold that is said to be especially effective against evil creatures.  The weapon hums slightly with a not unpleasant buzz, constantly reminding someone that it is there.  At the base of the grip is a holy symbol.

objects.short: a pair of loose, icy-blue pants
objects.ground: Pale blue pants lie neatly folded here.

extras.text: These pants are made out of a satiny material that feels soft and smooth, cold on the outside but comfortable when worn.  Large pockets should have enough room in them for as many oddments as one could desire, and a thin drawstring at the wait insures that they should fit anyone.  Given their shimmering appearance and comfortable fit, it is almost certain they are magical in nature.

objects.ground: A bright red scroll tied with a white ribbon rests here.

extras.text: Bright red seems an unusual color for parchment, but this scroll seems to be written on it nonetheless.  If unfurled, it is revealed that the scroll's writing is in spidery black symbols.  A pure white silk ribbon ties the scroll together, keeping its magic safe.

objects.ground: A torn piece of paper flutters in the wind.

extras.text: The paper is torn in half, but the readable half says: Half-Elf, Human, Barbarian Ickle, Mielikki, Anduin, N Cleric, Sorcerer, Warrior, Bugs, Demons, Orcs, Dragon

objects.ground: A sparkly blue feather rests on the ground here.

extras.text: It's a gorgeous wing feather from the rare ice garuda.  Slightly chilly to the touch, this kind of feather is prized among cryomancers for use as a quill. The sparkles are really tiny ice crystals embedded in the feather.

objects.ground: A chunk of blue stone seems to have fallen off the walls.

extras.text: An ovoid section of the walls is lying here.  One side is smooth, with half a star engraved in it.  The other side is rough, almost sharp when touched.  It looks like it was partly chipped out with a chisel and partly broken off by force.

objects.ground: A rose formed from sapphire rests gently here.

extras.text: A stem of silver with tiny thorns supports a gorgeous bud of sapphire, looking as though it has barely begun to bloom.  It has a slight scent similar to that of fresh rain wafting from the sapphire head, making it very pleasant to smell. Inscribed on the stem are tiny holy symbols.

objects.ground: A chest of silver and sapphire sits here, full of riches.

extras.text: Almost hidden under a pile of shed scales, this silver strongbox is studded with brilliant sapphires cut in many shapes and set into intriguing patterns. It is a rather large chest and appears to have no lock.  Still, it looks entirely too small for a dragon to open or close, so what use could he possibly have for it?

objects.ground: A blue silk ribbon is floating here.
A tasty chocolate chip cookie sits here.

extras.text: About the size of your palm, a soft, freshly baked cookie with tiny melting chocolate chips tantalizes your taste buds as its scent wafts up into your nostrils.  It would surely be the tastiest thing ever, so what are you waiting for?  Eat it!

objects.ground: An ethereal shape is floating here.

extras.text: A shimmering, ethereal mask, or perhaps just a trick of the light, it obscures living features and replaces them with a ghostly skull.  A pallid green glow emanates from the mask, making delicate stomachs queasy and striking terror into the hearts of the weak.  Looking at it from the back side, you can barely make out the word "Dakhod" in translucent letters.

objects.ground: A spiffy pirate outfit is here. Grab it quick!

extras.text: A full pirate suit done in varying shades of red, it was definately tailor-made for Dakhod.  From its red leather leggings to its striped red-and-white baggy shirt to the dark red, bloodstained bandana that can be worn under a captain's hat, this outfit is sure to strike terror into the hearts of mortals.

objects.ground: A red pirate sash lies here.

extras.text: A long bolt of red silk is twisted into a very neat looking sash that would be perfect for holding a cutlass and belting in a loose shirt.  At the ends of the sash are black embroidered Jolly Roger symbols, and one end has a little white tag with the name "Dakhod" written on it in black ink.

objects.ground: A silver bullet lies here.

extras.text: A silvery bullet lies here, inscribed with the pirate symbol of skull-and-crossbones.  The faint smell of sulphur wafts up from it as a testament to the black powder inside its shell.  Being made of silver, it should be especially powerful against lycanthropes.  A tiny "D" is engraved on the flat end.

objects.ground: A pistol lies here.

extras.text: This pistol is rougly the size of a child's arm, with a solid silver handle to grip it by inlaid with skulls and fitting your grip quite comfortably.  The flintlock itself is clean and looks like it would fire quickly.  The long steel barrel is slightly stained black from the powder used to fire it.  Such a weapon would be extremely dangerous if used improperly.  Engraved on one end of the barrel is the name "Dakhod".

objects.ground: A cutlass is lying here.

extras.text: Curving gracefully from hilt to tip, this cutlass is a work of art.  Its flaring guard is inlaid with silver skulls so that the poor soul at the receiving end can see his macabre demise before meeting his fate.  Razor-sharp and very dangerous-looking, it would probably cut through a normal pirate sash if its owner were not careful.  The hilt is set with a large black diamond, and looking closely into the depths of the gem you can see the blurry shape of letters, forming the word "Dakhod".

objects.ground: A golden hoop lies here in the dust.

extras.text: A thin golden hoop, this earring would look perfect on a pirate.  Slender and yet strong, masculine and yet flamboyant, the earring would look simply dashing on the right person.  It shines even in dim light as though it was polished recently.  In script so small it can hardly be seen, the name "Dakhod" is inscribed near the hilt.

objects.ground: A three-cornered hat is lying here.

extras.text: A well-worn and tattered pirate hat, this nifty three-cornered hat sweeps up at the front and has a faintly embroidered skull and crossbones on it.  Made of a soft brown felt, this hat would be protective in both sun and rain, not to mention in salty sea spray.  It has a fringe of brown feathers that are mostly worn away, and inside the front brim is the faded name "Dakhod" written in black ink.

objects.ground: A silver buckled slipper lies here.

extras.text: A pair of soft, velvety slippers with silver buckles is here, waiting for their owner.  The left one is cleverly modified to fit a round peg leg while still looking identical to the right slipper unless one peeks closely.  The look quite flashy and are surely the envy or pirates everywhere.  Embroidered in the inner heel of the right slipper is the name "Dakhod".

objects.ground: A silver hook gleams here.

extras.text: Gleaming brightly as though recently polished with oil, the hook looks at once sharp and deadly, yet it holds a beauty of form unlike anything else could. Made of the finest silver, it would surely take a pirate's hoard to commission something like this.  Engraved on the metal cuff is the name "Dakhod".

objects.ground: A wooden peg leg rests here.

extras.text: A stump of oak is fashioned into a replacement limb.  Weathered by much use, the bottom is scratched and rounded as if it has scrambled upon a pirate deck for many years.  Despite many scars of this nature, it seems very well made and looks like it would support the weight of even a portly pirate.

objects.ground: A black eyepatch is lying here.

extras.text: A thin string of braided silk is the tie for this fashionable eyepatch.  It looks like it would fit perfectly over an eye socket, whether to conceal a missing orb or to act as a disguise.  A single silver thread is sewn into the inner side of the patch, in the shape of the name "Dakhod".

triggers.name: dargentan-hug
triggers.commands: if %actor.align% > -350 msend %actor.name% The large dragon grins at you, displaying his teeth. mechoaround %actor% %self.name% grins toothily at %actor.name%. hug %actor.name% else growl %actor.name% end

triggers.name: wake-dargentan
triggers.commands: mutter msend %actor.name% %self.name% says, 'This had better be good!' mechoaround %actor.name% The dragon glares balefully at %actor.name%.

triggers.name: dargentan-sleep
triggers.commands: yawn wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Very well, then.  I will go back to sleep.' wait 1s sleep

triggers.name: dar-return
triggers.commands: if %self.room% != 23892 blink wait 1s mecho &9&bDargentan slowly fades out of existence and is gone.&0 mteleport %self% 23892 mecho &7&bDargentan blinks into existence.&0 end

triggers.name: icicle-get
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% != 23814 && %actor.vnum% != 23815 wait 1 odamage %actor% 50 cold if %damdone% > 0 osend %actor% The icicle freezes your fingers. (&4%damdone%&0) end end

triggers.name: dargentan-battle
triggers.commands: set val %random.10% switch %val% case 1 breath frost break case 2 case 3 sweep break case 4 case 5 roar break default growl done

triggers.name: solar-greet
triggers.commands: if %actor.align% < -349 cast 'soulshield' cast 'divine ray' %actor.name% end

triggers.name: solar-battle
triggers.commands: if %random.10% < 5 cast 'divine ray' end

triggers.name: mage_receive_refuse
triggers.commands: switch %object.vnum% case %wandgem% case %wandvnum% case %wandtask3% case %wandtask4% halt break default return 0 mecho %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'What is this for?' done

triggers.name: mage_greet
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == %wandstep% eval minlevel (%wandstep% - 1) * 10 if %actor.level% >= %minlevel% if %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:greet]% == 0 mecho %self.name% says, 'I see you're crafting something.  If you want my help, we can talk about &6&b[upgrades]&0.' else say Do you have what I need for the %weapon%? endif endif endif * Only greet people wearing the Sunfire crest if %actor.wearing[23716]% wait 2s blink wait 2s bow %actor.name% wait 1s say Far be it from me to ask how you got that crest...  But it appears you have done a service for one of my kin. wait 2s say Perhaps you can help me also in solving a riddle. endif

triggers.name: mage_speak1
triggers.commands: wait 1s frown wait 2s emote gestures at the symbols on the walls. say There is a riddle here, yes.  It is...somewhat complicated. emote takes a deep breath and begins to translate some runes. wait 3s say "Five friends from five towns liked five colors and stood in a line.  Each was a different race and class, and each fought a different enemy.  In my keep you will find all the information you need to solve the question I ask." wait 3s frown wait 1s emote gestures at the wall, looking frustrated. say But the question referred to is obscured by ice.

triggers.name: mage_speak2
triggers.commands: * Start the quest and give the Tempest a blue flame if !%get.mob_count[23803]% mat 23890 mload mob 23803 endif if %get.mob_count[23803]% mat 23890 m_run_room_trig 23813 end wait 1s nod wait 2s say It is surely the revenge of the elemental that Lord Dargentan keeps imprisoned here.  The Tempest Manifest ensures that the Keep stays afloat, but such creatures are never happy about being kept in servitude. wait 1s emote thinks a moment. wait 2s say Such beings can never truly be destroyed, but perhaps if you banished his form from this realm for a while, the ice would clear up and the question would become visible. wait 2s emote nods confidently. say Yes, perhaps that would be best.  If you would destroy the Tempest's mortal form and return to me with the remains, perhaps we could find the answer to this riddle. wait 1s frown wait 2s say But just in case I have not found all the correct clues, be sure to look for them throughout the keep. emote points to a gently glowing inscribed pentagram. wait 1s say Look at the pentagrams scattered around.  I believe there are fifteen of them.  You will need to look at all of them to get the clues. wait 2s bow %actor.name% say Good luck, and thank you for helping!

triggers.name: tempest_start_quest
triggers.commands: if !%has_flame% wforce tempest-manifest mload obj 23822 wforce tempest-manifest hold blue-flame set has_flame 1 global has_flame end

triggers.name: tempest_reset_quest
triggers.commands: wforce tempest-manifest mjunk blue-flame set has_flame 0 global has_flame

triggers.name: mage_receive
triggers.commands: * Reset quest in tempest room if %get.mob_count[23803]% mat 23890 m_run_room_trig 23814 end wait 1 mjunk blue-flame wait 1s mecho The mage's face brightens. msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You have banished the Tempest!  Excellent!  I think I can use this to remove the ice...' emote murmers some arcane phrases and the symbols on the wall begin to glow. wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'It says... eval question %random.4% global question switch %question% case 1 msend %actor% What is the race of the one from Ickle?' break case 2 msend %actor% What is the race of the one who fought demons?' break case 3 msend %actor% What is the class of the one who stood fourth in line from the right?' break case 4 msend %actor% What is the favored enemy of the barbarian?' break default msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Hrm... I can't seem to read it.' wait 2s frown wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Something is terribly wrong.  I think you should notify a god immediately.' done wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do you have the answer?'

triggers.name: mage_speak3
triggers.argument_list: barbarian human half-elf half-elven halfling gnome sorcerer cleric warrior rogue mercenary bugs bug dragons dragon orcs orc demons demon undead
triggers.commands: set halfelf half-elf set halfelven half-elven if %question% if %question% == 1 if %speech% == barbarian set correct yes elseif %speech% == human || %speech% == %halfelf% || %speech% == halfling || %speech% == gnome || %speech% == %halfelven% set correct no endif elseif %question% == 2 if %speech% == human set correct yes elseif %speech% == barbarian || %speech% == %halfelf% || %speech% == halfling || %speech% == gnome || %speech% == %halfelven% set correct no endif elseif %question% == 3 if %speech% == rogue set correct yes elseif %speech% == sorcerer || %speech% == cleric || %speech% == warrior || %speech% == mercenary set correct no endif elseif %question% == 4 if %speech% == orcs || %speech% == orc set correct yes elseif %speech% == bugs || %speech% == dragons || %speech% == demons || %speech% == undead || %speech% == bug || %speech% == dragon || %speech% == demon set correct no endif else wince say Something is terribly wrong...please inform a god. endif if %correct% == no set question 0 if !%get.mob_count[23803]% mat 23890 mload mob 23803 endif if %get.mob_count[23803]% mat 23890 m_run_room_trig 23813 end global question emote swears profusely as the ice reforms over the symbols on the wall. wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% casts a dirty look at you. mechoaround %actor% %self.name% scowls angrily at %actor.name%. say That was wrong! wait 2s sigh say Now the Tempest is back...  We would need to banish him again for another chance. elseif %correct% == yes set question 0 global question wait 1s emote nods slowly and traces one of the signs. wait 1s emote smiles happily. say Excellent!  That is indeed the correct answer! wait 1s thank %actor.name% say You have helped me more than I can say.  How can I ever repay you? wait 2s emote gets a big grin on his face. mload obj 23816 give glowing-key %actor.name% drop glowing-key bow %actor.name% wait 1s say Use it wisely! endif endif

triggers.name: tempest_fight
triggers.commands: if %random.10% < 4 wait 1s mecho The electrical charge around the Tempest grows stronger than the air can handle. wait 1 mecho Powerful arcs of &b&4lightning&0 jump from the Tempest Manifest, saturating the air with energy! m_run_room_trig 23818 else wait 1s mecho Lightning crackles through the Tempest, electrifying the air around its body. end

triggers.name: tempest_fight_room
triggers.commands: * * Lightning strikes half the number of people in the room * but not necessarily different people (mwahaha) * eval howmany %people.23890% / 2 set count 1 set truecount 1 while %count% < %howmany% eval victim %random.char% if %victim.vnum% != 23803 eval damage 150 + %random.30% if %victim.flags% /= SANCT eval damage %damage% - 75 elseif %victim.flags% /= STONE eval damage %damage% - 75 endif wdamage %victim% %damage% shock if %damage% == 0 wsend %victim% &b&4The lightning arcs off the Tempest Manifest, but is repelled from you!&0 wechoaround %victim% &b&4Lightning arcs off the Tempest Manifest, but is repelled from %victim.name%!&0 elseif %victim.flags% /= MAJOR_GLOBE wsend %victim% &b&1The &4lightning &1rips through the shimmering globe around your body and right into you!&0 (&1&b%damdone%&0) wechoaround %victim% &b&1The shimmering globe around %victim.name%'s body wavers as the &4lightning &1rips through it.&0 (&3%damdone%&0) else wsend %victim% &b&4The lightning arcs off the Tempest Manifest and into your body, causing your muscles to spasm wildly!&0 (&1&b%damdone%&0) wechoaround %victim% &b&4Lightning arcs off the Tempest Manifest, jolting %victim.name% with massive force!&0 (&3%damdone%&0) endif eval count %count% + 1 endif eval truecount %truecount% + 1 if %truecount% > 15 eval %count% %howmany% endif done

triggers.name: dargentan_drop_treasure
triggers.commands: return 0 m_run_room_trig 23820

triggers.name: dargentan_chest_load
triggers.commands: wload obj 23848 wecho As the dragon falls, you notice something that wasn't there before...

triggers.name: temptest-eq-drop
triggers.commands: return 0 mload obj 23825 drop pants

triggers.name: minstrel_test
triggers.commands: mecho Wheeeeeeee if (%self.worn[12]% == 48924) remove instrument-case open instrument-case get mandolin instrument-case hold mandolin sit wait 2s mecho %self.name% begins to play a mandolin softly. wait 2s mecho The music builds into a swelling crescendo. masound Beautiful music floats in from somewhere nearby. wait 4s mecho The music begins to fade as %self.name% wraps up the piece. masound The music fades away. wait 2s mecho %self.name% stops playing. stand bow wait 2s put mandolin instrument-case close instrument-case wear instrument-case else say I'm not wearing that end

triggers.name: half-elf_encoded_trigger
triggers.commands: if %actor.aff_flagged[COMP-LANG]% osend %actor% The circle around this pentagram is not a line, but rather tiny script. It osend %actor% reads: "The one who wore purple stood next to the half-elf". else osend %actor% this is a test message for now end if

triggers.name: wall-refit
triggers.commands: if (%object.vnum% == 23841) wait 1 s wdoor 23841 south description   "The one who wore purple stood next to the half-elf". wdoor 23841 south flags f wecho The wall flares with a pure white light as the broken fragment is joined to the whole. wecho The pentagram is completed. wait 60s wecho A piece of the wall slowly dissolves. wdoor 23841 south description The wall is broken here, interrupting the pentagram carved into it. wdoor 23841 south purge end

triggers.name: painting-speech
triggers.commands: if %actor.aff_flagged[DET_MAGIC]% == 1 wsend %actor% The painting speaks to you. 'Oh, are you here to ask about the quest?' wechoaround %actor% The painting on the ceiling speaks softly in a foreign tongue to %actor.name%. else wsend %actor% The painting speaks, but you do not feel that you understand its magical words. end

triggers.name: painting-clue
triggers.commands: if %actor.aff_flagged[DET-MAGIC]% == TRUE wsend %actor% The painting sighs. 'Yes, someone painted over the pentagram here.  Most unfortunate.  The clue read, "The one who fought dragons stood to the right of the sorcerer".' wait 1s wsend %actor% The painting says, 'I hope you find that useful.' wsend %actor% The painting goes back to studying the floor. wechoaround %actor% The painting speaks softly to %actor.name%. else wecho The painting speaks in a magical language. endif

triggers.name: genasi-port
triggers.commands: eval dest_room %random.37% + 23831 sigh say I really don't have time for this right now. mecho &9&b%self.name% slowly fades out of existence and is gone.&0 mteleport %self% %dest_room% mecho &7&b%self.name% blinks into existence.&0

rooms.name: Hovering Above the Cloud Path
rooms.description: Hovering slightly above the cloudy platform, the winds blow strongly down from the vortex above.  The cloud path is solid to the northwest, but it is unreachable from here.  There doesn't seem to be much here, besides air and the ever-present wind, but it is not so strong that it prevents upward travel.

rooms.name: On the Cloud Path
rooms.description: Strangely, this path seems to be made of cloud so thick it can easily be walked on.  Solid ground is down, only a short hop, but the path continues south.  It looks like it goes for quite a ways up, into the teeming mass of clouds that never seems to calm down.  The wind is rather chilly, but it's nothing a good warm coat can't keep out.

rooms.name: On the Cloud Path
rooms.description: The path of solid cloud continues to the north and south here.  It rises gently to the south, and is rather springy underfoot.  Be careful not to wander off the path - though it is hardly ten feet above the ground, it would not be a pleasant fall.  It looks like there is some kind of large cloud farther to the south.  Perhaps it is a destination for this strange path?

rooms.name: On the Cloud Path
rooms.description: The path definitely rises to the south and declines to the north.  The large mass of clouds to the south is closer now, and it appears to be made of the same springy, supportive cloud that this path is.  The wind is also slightly stronger here.  Hopefully it won't get stronger the farther up one goes, because it looks like this path goes quite a ways up!

rooms.name: On the Cloud Path
rooms.description: The cloud path spirals up here onto the platform and leads back to the ground farther north.  The ground is about twenty feet below the path.  The clouds here are a bit tougher and less springy than they are lower on the path, though the reason for this is not apparent.

rooms.name: A Platform of Clouds
rooms.description: Against all probability, this does indeed seem to be a solid platform made entirely of clouds.  Misty bits of normal cloud occasionally drift by, but they are virtually insubstantial.  The wind is stronger here as well, and the ground is no longer visible.  The path leads down, and the platform continues to the south and west.

rooms.name: A Platform of Clouds
rooms.description: Unlike the rest of the platform, this section is soft and springy.  The wind beats down heavily from above in a rather unnatural-seeming downdraft, and the air is very cold.  Heavy boots tend to sink into the soft cloud, and light clothing might get blown off by the wind.  The platform solidifies to the north and west, or you could brave the winds and go up.

rooms.name: A Platform of Clouds
rooms.description: The solid cloud platform continues east and south, and part of it breaks off and spirals up.  Another path splits off from it, leading even higher into the clouds.  Perhaps that path will lead to answers about the origin of the odd solid clouds that make sky-high travel possible.

rooms.name: A Platform of Clouds
rooms.description: The firm cloud platform stretches both north and east here.  It is high enough above the surrounding lands to provide a nice view of treetops, though not much else is visible.  A cold wind blows gently and continuously, so wearing warm clothing would be advisable.

rooms.name: The Upper Cloud Path
rooms.description: The solid path leads west from here, though one could easily jump off the path by going north, east or south.  Down leads back to the platform and relative safety.  The winds are rather strong on the path, though clouds on all sides obscure what would surely be a beautiful view on a clear day.

rooms.name: The Upper Cloud Path
rooms.description: The solid cloud path continues to the east and south here, though going any other direction would probably make one fall off the clouds altogether.  The strong winds tug at loose clothing, and thick clouds obscure the view of the surrounding area.  This place would be the perfect habitat for air elementals and other such creatures that don't mind the cold.

rooms.name: The Upper Cloud Path
rooms.description: The narrow path of solid cloud continues north and south here, and the deceptive thin clouds to the east and west would probably drop someone on an uncomfortably long fall.  The air is thin and cold as this path is quite high above the surrounding lands, though it is not yet difficult to breathe. Continuing upwards - to the south - might make breathing more troublesome.

rooms.name: The Upper Cloud Path
rooms.description: The solid cloud path continues north and south, with sharp drops to the east and west.  South, the path slopes ever so slightly upwards leading to a strange destination.  After all, what could be hidden in the clouds above?  The low visibility blocks vision for more than about ten feet in any direction, though the sunlight filtered through the clouds is plenty to see by.

rooms.name: The Upper Cloud Path
rooms.description: The path leads north here and slopes upwards to the east.  The springy cloud material provides little traction against the high winds coming from all directions, yet even with all this wind the air seems thin.  It is difficult to tell how high above the world the path leads, yet the ever-shifting clouds provide interesting changes in the scenery as far as one can see - though that distance is only about ten feet.

rooms.name: The Upper Cloud Path
rooms.description: The cloud path leads directly up and back west here, difficult to tell apart from the surrounding strata.  The wind is still very strong, and the air gets colder as the path leads higher.  Treacherous falls lie to the north, south and east, though following the path should be safe.

rooms.name: The Upper Cloud Path
rooms.description: A giant wall of clouds roils and seethes to the west and south, blocking passage.  The path itself leads north and down, and a fall lies to the east. The wall of clouds has a slight vortex effect, pulling air and very light objects towards it, though heavy things like adventurers weighed down by armor ought to be safe.

rooms.name: The Upper Cloud Path
rooms.description: The path continues west and south from here, sloping upwards to the west and downwards to the south.  There is a wall of chaotic cloud to the southwest, but it does not impede progress from here, though it does slightly pull everything in that direction.  Sudden gusts of wind throw the unwary off balance, but the path is firm and steady.

rooms.name: The Upper Cloud Path
rooms.description: The firm cloud path takes a sharp turn here, leading east and south.  It slopes gently upwards to the south and downwards to the east, though at times it is difficult to see the path because of the ubiquitous, misty clouds of almost the exact same hue that constantly travel in and out of one's field of vision.  Though the wind is cold, it is not so cold as to make traveling more than a little bit uncomfortable.

rooms.name: The Upper Cloud Path
rooms.description: A roiling wall of grey-black clouds rises to the east, blocking passage, but the trail continues north and south, sloping slightly upwards to the south. Going west would probably be a bad idea, since there's nothing there but empty air and some rather decidedly unsolid-looking clouds.

rooms.name: The Upper Cloud Path
rooms.description: The path takes another sharp turn here, leading both north and east.  To the east, it slopes upwards at a rather sharp angle - possibly to avoid the wall of dangerous-looking black and grey clouds to the northeast by going over it. What wind there is is drawn to the black cloudwall, though it is not terribly strong.

rooms.name: The Upper Cloud Path
rooms.description: The cloud path leads westward, sloping sharply down from here.  It does not appear to continue in any other direction, ending in a cloud wall.  Then again, the cloud wall is white and firm, unlike the black and grey cloud wall to the northwest.  It looks like there are plenty of handholds for a determined climber, though the idea of climbing a cloud is itself rather unusual.

rooms.name: The Upper Cloud Path
rooms.description: A solid cloud wall, complete with handholds, leads down.  The clouds are solid to the north, but all other directions lead off the cloud path and probably to a nasty fall.  The air is very thin here, but it is not too difficult to breathe.  You must be very high above the world by now, but it is not entirely clear where you are since the clouds effectively block vision for a ways.  A large, dark mass is visible above and to the southwest - the destination of this odd path?

rooms.name: The Upper Cloud Path
rooms.description: The cloud path turns sharply to the west and south, with the western area being slightly higher in elevation.  North and east drop off the path - it looks like a very long drop.  The winds are not as strong here as they have been on other parts of the path, as you seem to be approaching its end. Glimpses of a large, sparkling, bluish structure appear above you from time to time, though its purpose is still unclear.

rooms.name: The Upper Cloud Path
rooms.description: The clouds are solid to the east and west, dropping off to the north and south.  It is a good thing the path is wide, because falling off at this point would most assuredly not be pleasant.  There must be some magic involved in keeping the air on the path thick enough to breathe - and warm enough that ice does not form in your lungs.

rooms.name: The Upper Cloud Path
rooms.description: The solid clouds that form the path turn again here, leading both south and east.  The bulk of the mysterious structure is directly above you, blocking all sunlight and making it rather more chilly than it would be with the help of the sun.  It is dark blue and looks like it is made of stone, but its structure and function remain unclear.

rooms.name: The Upper Cloud Path
rooms.description: The path leads north and south here, with a nasty drop to the east or west. The clouds rise to the south, perhaps heading into the dark structure which looms above.  The cold is bone-chilling, but the air is still warm enough to breathe.  The path also narrows here, but it is still wide enough that a careful person need not fear falling.

rooms.name: The Upper Cloud Path
rooms.description: The path turns once again, leading west, which slopes upwards, and north, which slopes downwards.  You are very close to the structure here, which at this distance does indeed seem to be made of stone.  It casts a dark blue shadow on everything nearby, including you.  East and south lead to a long drop back to the lands below.

rooms.name: The End of the Upper Cloud Path
rooms.description: The solid clouds that form the path end here, leading east only.  There is a stairway of cold blue stone leading upwards into the giant structure hovering above you.  The stairs are engraved with abstract curves and lines, some resembling arcane symbols and some looking totally unfamiliar.  One image, however, is very clear: that of a dragon.

extras.text: The signs, though they appear random, decorate the rather eye-catching form of a dragon on the stairs.  Carved directly into the blue stone, the dragon's true color is unknown.

rooms.name: A Chamber of Silver in the Clouds
rooms.description: Light is scarce in this room, but the walls to the east and south glimmer brightly.  The blue stone of the walls appears to be engraved with silver. The silver forms patterns both abstract and familiar, with feathered beasts dancing in arcane patterns.  Runes decorate the stairway down and the ceiling is more blue stone with silver highlighting.  The room seems quite warm compared to the cloudy, windswept path outside.  The room continues to the north and west, or you could leave the structure by going down.

extras.text: Runes are inscribed on the stairway here.  Upon closer inspection, they are revealed to be Dwarven runes, which read: "To the great lord Dargentan in return for a service to the Kingdom" with the year "423" noted below the inscription.  However, there is no record of which Kingdom is referred to, which Dwarves worked on the building, or what the service was.
A variety of creatures can be seen on the walls here, though many are simply abstract representations.  The arcane symbols are those representing stability, prosperity, and security.

rooms.name: A Chamber of Silver in the Clouds
rooms.description: Not as bright as the room to the east, this room still gleams with silvery engravings.  The contrast of the dark blue stone and silver highlights is quite aesthetically pleasing.  Here are more of the same arcane symbols as before, as well as some hexagonal abstracts that seem unfamiliar, and a strangely familiar-looking silver flame.  The ceiling is high in here, made for creatures larger than the average humanoid, no doubt.  The room continues to the east and north.

extras.text: A lonely flame burns here, all in silver.  It is the symbol of the holy favor of the god Pergus.

Symbols of warding against evil and general security are subtly worked into the decorations for this room.  Some unfamiliar patterns may be arcane in nature, but it is possible they are simply decorative.

Points and curves flow into six-sided patterns, every one unique.  They are scattered randomly around the room, their silver sheen reflecting pleasantly in the light.  Suddently it dawns on you what they are supposed to represent: Snowflakes!

rooms.name: A Chamber of Silver in the Clouds
rooms.description: This spacious room is, like the others around it, covered in silver engravings and very spacious.  Shapes familiar and unfamiliar cover the walls, and here and there the silver is engraved with pictures of fantastic beasts and strange buildings.  Glimmering light gives an impression of a ghostly presence, but the room is suffused with a comforting aura.  The silver chamber continues to the east and south.

extras.text: Though the symbols are more abstract than realistic, someone with an active imagination could pick out griffins, angels, a phoenix, an elemental and other creatures of the sky in the engravings of silver on the blue stone walls. There is one that definately resembles a building with arching windows and tall spires - perhaps it is a temple to some god or goddess.
On the leftmost spire of the temple is a symbol: an inverted triangle with spheres on all three sides.  In tiny Elven runes it says, "Kourrya 2006".

rooms.name: A Chamber of Silver in the Clouds
rooms.description: The chamber of silvery figures inscribed into blue stone is very detailed in this corner, with highlights over nearly every bump and carving in the walls and ceiling.  There is a door to the east with cloudy symbols illuminating a keyhole, and the chamber also continues to the south and west.  The ceiling is arched in this section rather than flat, and the inner curve is carved into the shape of a bird with a solid silver beak pointing to the east.

East.description: Cloudy figures surround a keyhole in this door.

extras.text: The bird carved into the arch here resembles a phoenix, but where a phoenix is a creature of fire, this is a creature of ice.  Tiny silver snowflakes trail from its in-flight pose, and its feathers resemble ice crystals.

rooms.name: A Hall of Smoky Quartz
rooms.description: This hallway, while made of the same blue stone as the rest of the building, is embedded with smoky quartz gems in different patterns.  It is a bit colder here than in the chamber of silver to the west, but it is certainly not a life-threatening cold.  A wall to the south blocks passage in that direction and a door with silver engravings stands to the west.  The smoky quartz hall continues to the north and east.  There is a large pillar to the northeast as well.

West.description: A door with a silver keyhole stands in this direction.

extras.text: The smoky quartz is inset into many patterns both arcane and mundane.  On the ceiling there is a mural of sorts, with a young girl and an older, powerful-looking woman.  The older woman's eyes are inset with crystals of smoky quartz.
A massive pillar of dark blue stone supports the ceiling.  Inscribed on it are the arcane runes for stability and flight.

rooms.name: A Hall of Smoky Quartz
rooms.description: This is the southern end of a wide hallway inset with many smoky quartz gems.  Painted frescoes on the ceiling are accented by the dark gems, giving the illusion of wide space.  Not that the space isn't large - it is wide enough for even the most massive of creatures to pass through - but between the gems winking in the light and the constant wind, it feels more like a field than a building.  A wall blocks passageway to the south, and the hall continues to the north, east, and west.  Pillars support the ceiling to the northeast and northwest.

extras.text: Pillars of dark blue stone stand to the northeast and northwest here, inscribed with arcane runes of safety and flight.
The ceiling frescoes here show a young woman gesturing rudely to a man in a black cloak.  The man's eyes are represented by small smoky quartz gems.  The scene is richly colored.

rooms.name: A Hall of Smokey Quartz
rooms.description: The hall of smoky quartz bends here, with wide passageways going both west and south.  It is wide enough that you can continue in any direction, and once again studded in the gray gems.  They reflect light well, sparkling without hurting the eyes.  Large pillars stand to the northwest and southeast, and the ceiling is brightly painted.

extras.text: The ceiling frescoes here show a young woman with dark hair peering into a cave, while an older-looking woman stands far away and laughs.  The older woman's eyes are set with smoky quartz gems.

Large pillars of blue stone stand to the northwest and southeast, supporting the ceiling.  Inscribed with runes for safety and flight, they are surely essential to the structural integrity of the building.

rooms.name: A Hall of Smoky Quartz
rooms.description: The great hall curves to the west and south here, with walls of cold blue stone to the east and north blocking passage.  Magical symbols accented by smoky quartz line the walls and ceiling in many shapes including runes, an inscribed pentagram, a triangle surrounded by small circles, and some random-seeming lines.

extras.text: The circle around this pentagram is not a solid line at all, but letters in tiny, flowing script.  It reads: "The cleric was known to like violet".

A few triangles and circles are scattered around on the walls and ceiling, some accented by smoky quartz and some looking like they could form pictures. There are also spirals and squares, but not as many as there are triangles.
A few runes and lines are scattered at random here.  They don't seem to indicate anything in particular.

rooms.name: A Hall of Smoky Quartz
rooms.description: The wide hallway extends north and south here, and you can also head east. The wind in this hall seems to be coming from that direction, though, so it is rather cold.  The smoky quartz lines the walls, highlighting important figures in the frescoes and gently reflecting the light.  A wall to the west blocks passage in that direction, and pillars are visible to the northeast and southeast.

extras.text: The frescoes on the ceiling here show a grim scene of a young woman imprisoned in a cave with bars accented by smoky quartz.  Her expression is one of despair.
Pillars of large blue stone stand to the northeast and southeast, inscribed with the magical runes of safety and flight.  Beyond them, the hall stretches out even farther.

rooms.name: A Hall of Smoky Quartz
rooms.description: You are on the eastern side of a large hall.  The ceiling is gently arched and painted with bright scenes, accented by chunks of smoky quartz that take up the light and disperse it in all directions.  Pillars to the northwest and southwest support the structure and frame the western end of the hall.  You may continue in any direction, but the eastern exit is a small alcove and would be leaving the large hall.  Wind whips in coldly from that direction.

extras.text: To the northwest and southwest, large pillars of blue stone support the gently arched ceiling.  They have the arcane runes for safety and flight inscribed on them, probably keeping the building afloat.
The frescoes on the ceiling show a man with black hair and a long cloak travelling through mountainous terrain.  His eyes are represented by tiny, radiant smoky quartz gems.

rooms.name: A Platform at the Edge of the Hall
rooms.description: This room rather resembles an alcove from the great hall to the west. Chilly winds keep the air moving in here, but investigating their source to the east is probably a bad idea.  Like the main hallway, the alcove has beautiful paintings on the ceiling inset with sparkling smoky quartz, but there are tiny ice crystals on them because of the constant wind and cold.  This suggests that the eastern edge of the platform drops directly into the clouds, though it is difficult to see past the edge of the platform.

extras.text: The inscription reads, "The Death of Gods searches for his beloved Raven".

Though slightly encrusted with ice, the paintings that decorate the ceiling are nonetheless beautiful and bright.  Their subject, however, is not.  A man with black hair and a long cloak, his eyes represented by smoky quartz, searches for something through many different terrains with a look of despair on his face.  There is an inscription at the eastern end of the painting.

rooms.name: A Hall of Rose Quartz
rooms.description: Rose quartz, both polished and faceted, highlights this room with a warm, pink feeling.  Playful figures decorate the walls to the south and east and more abstract designs are visible on the ceiling: a collection of wavy lines, a triangle-shaped humanoid figure, a pentagram inscribed in a circle, and so on. The wide hall continues to the north and west, and a large pillar stands to the northwest.

extras.text: A pillar stands to the northwest, made of the same blue stone as the rest of the structure.  It is covered with arcane runes indicating flight and safety.
The circle is not a line, but rather a thin, flowing script.  It reads: "The one from Ogakh stood on one end".
A vivid imagination is all that is needed to turn these seemingly random figures into a tale of betrayal and hope...  Or maybe they are just shapes.
Humans and tiny, dragonlike creatures play in this section of the walls. One of the little dragonlike figures is breathing a fiery stream of rose quartz.

rooms.name: A Hall of Rose Quartz
rooms.description: This part of the hallway is studded in rose quartz, which nicely complements the blue stone that the structure is made out of.  A wall blocks passageway to the west, but the hall does extend in all other directions.  Frescoes decorate the ceiling, accentuating the beauty of your surroundings.  A light breeze blows here, keeping the air fresh.  A large pillar stands to the northeast, supporting the room.

extras.text: A pillar of dark blue stone rises to the northeast, supporting the wide hall.  Inscribed on it are runes for flight and safety.

Brilliant greens and blues dominate this picture, which is of two figures wearing armor riding over a hill.  An unconscious figure is on the other side of the hill waiting for them, and a wall of shadow roils in the background.

rooms.name: A Hall of Rose Quartz
rooms.description: This hall is somewhat smaller than the one to the north, but it is still wide enough for many people to stand in.  Rose quartz accents give the hall a warm glow, and gently flowing curves resolve themselves into wavy representations of different celestial bodies studded with the pink gems.  One piece on the southern wall looks rough and indented, as though some vandal chipped off part of the blue stone to get at the gems set in it.  The hallway continues north and west.

extras.text: Suns, stars and moons decorate the southern and eastern walls, representing many different planes.  Maybe that one is Ethilien?
The circle around this pentagram is not a line, but rather tiny script.  It reads: "The one who wore purple stood next to the half-elf".
The wall's smoothly polished surface is roughly broken here, interrupting a nice carving of a pentagram.  Perhaps if the missing piece of wall could be found, the carving would made whole again.

rooms.name: A Hall of Rose Quartz
rooms.description: This hall is a little narrower than others in the building, but still comfortably wide.  The ceiling arches playfully, inlaid with tile mosaic stones forming a picture interspersed with winking gems of rose quartz.  The walls are more uniformly decorated to the north and south, though the eastern and western walls are too far away to see as the hall continues in both directions.  The air here is fresh, but not as cold as in other sections of the hall.

extras.text: The ceiling here is inlaid with a colorful mosaic depicting a small fortress near some dark, ominous-lookig mountains.  Two figures on horseback aproach the castle with a third figure, either dead or unconscious, slung on the back of one of the horses.

The pieces of the mosaic, called tesserae, interlock snugly with each other to form a beautiful picture.  Some tiles are made of the rose quartz, and others have tiny, faceted rose quartz gems decorating them.

rooms.name: A Hall of Rose Quartz
rooms.description: The hallway turns here, leading both east and south.  A solid wall of blue stone encrusted with rose quartz stands to the west, and a more moderate- looking wall stands to the north.  A light breeze comes from the south, its cool air refreshing all in its path.  Several runes and arcane symbols are grouped along the northwestern junction of the two walls, including some Draconic runes, an inscribed pentagram, and the four-pointed divine symbol of a solar god.

extras.text: The symbol here is a beaten copper sun with four long rays pointing in the cardinal directions.  In its center is a smooth, pink rose quartz.
Here is a five-pointed star inscribed in a circle, but the circle is not a line.  Rather, it is tiny, flowing script which reads: "The dwarf was laughed at, for his favorite enemies were giant bugs".
The runes spell out a name, "Dargentan".

rooms.name: A Hall of Rose Quartz
rooms.description: An intricately decorated wall lies to the west and a plain blue stone wall lies to the east, both blocking passage in those directions, but the wide hall continues north and south without obstacle.  There is a brisk wind coming from the south, giving the stones around you a chilly feel that contrasts with the warm, pink appearance of the rose quartz.  A bright mosaic decorates the ceiling, giving the hallway colors besides blue and pink.

extras.text: This mosaic shows a brown-haired man in a purple shirt sitting at a desk covered in papers and trophies.  He writes a document with a quill pen, but smiles as he does so.  The walls of his office are lavishly decorated, showing his wealth.

Rose quartz stones accent the carvings and grooves on the western wall, but they seem random rather than solid representations of anything in particular. The carvings are, however, quite pleasant to look at.

rooms.name: A Turn in the Hall
rooms.description: A wide platform opens up to the south, giving an absolutely stunning view of the surrounding lands.  Vast stretches of green and blue assault the senses, and the white and grey clouds seem mountainous in their own right.  You are very high off the ground indeed, so stepping out for a closer look at the world's beauty might prove to be fatal.  A chilly wind blows from the open air to the south, giving the hall's decorations a thin layer of ice.  The rose quartz hall continues to the north, and the aventurine hall begins to the western edge of this platform.

extras.text: The ceiling here is decorated with a colorful mosaic, though it is slightly icy due to the constant exposure to the weather.  The mosaic shows a brown-haired man in a purple tunic walking through a colorful marketplace, smiling.
To the south, clouds billow intermittently, forming shapes of mountains and valleys higher and deeper than the ones land-dwelling creatures are probably comfortable with.

rooms.name: A Turn in the Hall
rooms.description: This is the southern end of the aventurine hall, ending in a platform that gives a stunning view of the lands to the south.  Vast expanses of green, forested hills compete with a dark lake and the white and grey clouds, making a veritable tapestry of the world.  A cartographer would pay dearly for this kind of view, but it is very dangerous - one step off the platform would surely mean a very long drop to the rocks below.  The ceiling is decorated with a colorful mosaic, but it is coated with a thin layer of ice due to the constant exposure to clouds, wind and cold.  The aventurine hall continues to the north, and it curves and turns into a hall studded with rose quartz to the east.

extras.text: The mosaic here shows a brown-haired man pleading with a man in a general's uniform.  It is unclear what he is pleading for, but he looks quite urgent. The general looks thoughtful.  The entire scene is glazed over with a thin layer of ice from the constant winds.
The clouds are on an even level with you for the most part, though some are actually below you.  You must be very high up in the sky.

rooms.name: A Hall of Aventurine
rooms.description: The ceiling and walls are covered with symbols: an equilateral triangle, an oak, an inscribed pentagram and others.  They are decorated with beautiful, opaque green aventurine crystals in this section of the building.  Though not a translucent crystal, aventurine catches the light well and accents the arcane symbols on the ceiling of the hall as well as adding a pleasant touch to the walls around you.  The western wall is much colder to the touch, as it is the outer surface of the structure and constantly exposed to the elements.  A cold wind blows from the south, and the hallway also continues to the north.

extras.text: This pentagram is inscribed inside a circle, but the circle is not a solid line.  Instead, it is a tiny flowing script which reads: "The human wore purple and stood to the right of the one who fought dragons".

The oak tree, ever sacred to druids, is a symbol of protection and stability.  Triangles in perfect equilibrium are for balance.  Other symbols also decorate the walls here, but those two seem very prominent.

rooms.name: A Hall of Aventurine
rooms.description: Artistically decorated with tiny blue and green aventurine crystals, this hall is very wide - more than wide enough to accommodate even the largest creatures.  The hall narrows to the south, and it continues to the north and west.  There are also beautiful paintings on the ceiling, and to the northwest there is a large pillar supporting the hall.

extras.text: A large pillar of blue stone is here, supporting the high ceiling. Inscribed on it are the arcane runes for safety and flight.

The ceiling painting here shows a rather grim scene - a fortress near some mountains being attacked by dark shadows.  Still figures line the ground, but in the back hills there is a column of fleeing figures who look like they have escaped the worst.

rooms.name: A Hall of Aventurine
rooms.description: The hall is spacious here, with massive pillars rising to the northeast and northwest.  Colorful frescoes decorate the ceiling, and aventurine of both the green and the blue variety highlight the decorations.  It is slightly chilly in here, but not as cold as one would expect - there is probably magic involved in keeping the place warm enough for humanoid comfort.  Travel is possible in all directions except south, where a wall protects you from the elements.

extras.text: Large columns of blue stone rise to the northeast and northwest, inscribed with the arcane runes for safety and flight.  They provide both physical support for the hall and, no doubt, magical support to keep it flying.

The colorful frescoes in this room show a man in general's garb leading a band of refugees through a forest.  Some of the refugees are injured, and a few of them are looking around themselves nervously.  The general has an expression of determination on his face.

rooms.name: A Hall of Aventurine
rooms.description: This is the southwest corner of the great hall covered in aventurine. Bright frescoes adorn the ceiling, with tiny crystals inset in it to accentuate the colors.  A pillar of blue stone rises to the northeast, and the hall itself continues to the north and east.  The walls are quite cold, but it is a comfortable temperature elsewhere in the hall.

extras.text: Brilliantly colored figures are painted on the ceiling here, showing a picture of refugees exiting a tunnel into a verdant forest.  The refugees are led by a man in a general's uniform and a brown-haired man in a purple tunic, both of whom have eyes of aventurine crystal.
A massive pillar stands to the northeast, supporting the hallway.  It is carved with many arcane runes of safety and flight, adding to the structural and magical integrity of the building.

rooms.name: A Hall of Aventurine
rooms.description: The grand hall continues in all directions, large enough for even the most massive creatures.  Blue aventurine crystals, slightly different colored than the blue stone that makes up the walls, catch the light and give the room a shimmering feeling.  Pillars rise to the northwest and southeast, supporting the ceiling.  A fresco also decorates the ceiling, adding some color to the room so the blue isn't overwhelming.

extras.text: Blue pillars rise majestically to the northwest and southeast, engraved with arcane runes that symbolize flight and safety.

This bright painting shows an elven man and his family in a forest village, surrounded by brilliant greens.  The man seems blissfully happy, and his son looks excited and clutches a four-pointed sun symbol.

rooms.name: A Hall of Aventurine
rooms.description: The large hall continues north and east, though cold walls block passage to the east and south.  A pillar stands to the northeast, supporting the hallway. It is a bit chilly here, though not uncomfortably so.  Green and blue aventurine stud the walls, providing a pleasant atmosphere.  A few symbols decorate the walls, among them a hexagon, a chain of circles, and an inscribed pentagram.

extras.text: A massive pillar of blue stone is here, solidly supporting the ceiling of the great hall.  Carved into it are arcane symbols of flight and protection.
The symbols are artistically arranged here into an arrangement that pleases the eye.  The chain of circles in particular has a wavy, almost mesmerizing appearance.
The pentagram is inscribed in a circle of flowing text, which reads: "The human stood next to his friend from Mielikki".

rooms.name: A Platform at the Edge of the Hall
rooms.description: The hall empties onto a tiny platform here, with the winds blowing strongly in from the west.  It is very cold here, and masses of clouds roil to the west, indicating a nasty drop in that direction.  It would surely be a bad idea to proceed that way, as you are very high above the ground.  Around the platform, the walls are decorated with quite a variety of magical symbols: everything from spirals and runes to an oak tree, a deity's holy symbol, and an inscribed pentagram.  Next to each symbol is a tiny indentation, some of which are filled with gems of different varieties.  The main hall is back to the east.

extras.text: The symbols all glow with a faint white light, warm to the touch although the constant wind and cold has left a thin sheet of ice over everything else.
There must be at least thirty different symbols here, all unique.  Next to some of them, in the small indent, there are various precious gems: rubies, sapphires, emeralds, and even diamonds.
Next to an empty indent there is a pentagram inscribed in a circle.  The circle is not, however, a solid line.  It is a line of script, which reads: "The sorcerer valiantly fought undead".

rooms.name: A Hall of Aventurine
rooms.description: The wide hall continues north, south and east here, with a small alcove to the west.  Chill winds blow strongly from the alcove, making this section of the hall rather cold.  Pillars to the northeast and southeast support the hall, which is decorated with hundreds of tiny aventurine crystals as well as beautiful paintings on the ceiling.  The ceiling arches gently, probably to support the weight of all this stone.  But then, what is supporting the weight below the building?  Clouds?

extras.text: Massive pillars of blue stone stand to the northeast and southeast, engraved with the magical runes for flight and safety.  Perhaps they conduct the magic that keeps the structure afloat?

Reds and blacks color this painting, which seems almost out of place in the blue peace of the hall.  It shows an elf held captive by demons with fiery manes, all with expressions of anger on their faces.  The elf's eyes are represented with shards of blue aventurine.

rooms.name: A Hall of Aventurine
rooms.description: You are on the eastern end of a large north-south hall.  A wall blocks the way to the east, but the west leads to the other end of the large hall. Pillars stand to the northwest and southwest, made of the same blue stone as the wall to the east and the floors beneath your feet.  The ceiling is decorated with an intricate painting.  A chill wind blows from farther west, making the wall cold to the touch.

extras.text: Huge pillars support the ceiling to the northwest and southwest, engraved with arcane symbols of flight and protection.  They are very similar to the other pillars scattered around this building.

The ceiling shows a dark scene - a horde of demons covered in fire attacking a small forest village.  Most of the population is lying on the ground, dead or unconscious, but some are being held captive by the demons.  The demons are lead by a hulking figure encased in flames.

rooms.name: A Hall of Chrysoprase
rooms.description: This is the northwest corner of a very large, very wide hall.  It is a bit chilly, owing to a slight breeze coming from the southwest.  A large, supportive pillar rises to the southeast, and everything is covered with vividly green chrysoprase stones.  The green of the stones matches the blue of the walls quite well, and a painting on the ceiling also adds to the decor. The hall continues east and south.

extras.text: A giant blue pillar rises to the southeast, covered in runes and stones. Though the stones are the same chrysoprase that cover the rest of the hall, the runes are quite magical, representing flight and safety.

The painting on the ceiling is quite ornate, showing a destroyed hellish-looking fortress and a retreating army of brilliant, white figures. Amid the wreckage stands a scarred and broken elf, looking confused and alone. The elf's eyes are tiny gems.

rooms.name: A Hall of Chrysoprase
rooms.description: Brilliant green chrysoprase decorates the blue walls here, giving the hall a beautiful, natural feel.  A blue pillar rises to the southwest, and a wall decorated with arcane symbols lies to the east.  The ceiling is painted with figures that seem alive with their bright colors and realistic portrayal.
